column4: could some one help me install vmware tools in ubuntu(guest)? I cant figure out the mount point.
Let me see if I still have an ubuntu VM client set up.
ohh i heard server is crud, you should try out workstation
yeah i just plan on running a private test server
ok so where do i go from there, i have it mounted
I have to check the forums, it's been a while.
it says mount then switch to temp dir
it says switch temp then do the rpm install - rpm -Uhv /mnt/cdrom/VMwareTools-<xxxx>.i386.rpm
let me try that real quick brb
seems to be installing, thanks alot!
one other thing, i have a folder on my desktop, but it wont let me copy it to /var/www , says i dont have permision, i try assigning permision, but it wont copy still, any idea?
What's the permissions and owner/group on /var/www?
thanks, ill try that here in a few, tia though!
